user_sentiment: Neutral to pragmatic - the follow-up message acknowledges a constraint change (can't test fudge anymore) rather than expressing dissatisfaction with the prior work. This suggests the work was completed acceptably but external circumstances have changed the project's direction.

work_category: Preparation of build infrastructure using subagents to set up worktrees for a multi-agent development workflow. The agent delegated work to specialized subagents rather than performing tasks directly.
summary: The agent successfully delegated worktree preparation to subagents as requested, demonstrating good use of parallel task execution. The follow-up message indicates external constraints have changed (fudge unavailable), not dissatisfaction with the completed work. Minor misalignment exists in that the agent prepared infrastructure for a testing approach that is no longer viable, though the worktrees themselves remain useful.
follow_up_pattern: The user is pivoting the testing strategy due to tool availability constraints. This suggests the prior worktree preparation work is still valid, but the testing methodology needs adjustment.
